result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Jon Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillip Jon Mueller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillip Jon Mueller was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Eau Claire County Jail today September 18, 2017 by 6:00 p.m. to serve balance of Jail time.
Court will consider 1 day credit towards mandatory report.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Driver Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs and restitution.
Apply bond on file and balance of $420.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF376/

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Defendant to comply with all programming through Probation.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED for 30 days.
May be served in Eau Claire County Jail at no expense to St. Croix County.
Huber granted for work.
Defendant to be released at 7:00 a.m. Saturday August 19, 2017.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK:Evenson. ADA:  Kaley Walker DF ATTY: Michael R. Cohen DF: Phillip Jon Mueller appeared. Case called at 8:36. Includes 15TR3862, 15CF376. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  G to Ct 1 in  15CF376. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in  15CF376. On motion of the State without objection, Crt merges and dismisses Ct 4 and outright dismisses Ct. 2 and 3 in 15CF376 and 15TR3862. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statment. DE is supervised out of Eau Claire County Emily Siakpere. Crt orders: Sentence W/H

3 years probation with conditions:
- 330  days conditional jail STAYED for 30 days -can be served in Eau Claire County at no charge to  St. Croix County
  DE to report to Eau Claire Jail by Sept. 18 by 6:00pm to serve balance of the jail time.
  huber granted for work.
- 2 years DL revocation 
   credit for administrative suspension.
- 2 years IID
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- AODA and driver's safety plan. 
- ff of $1170.00 inclusive of costs and restitution to SCSO. 
  to be paid through DOC. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols.
- DE to comply with all programming through probation. 

DE to report today and Court will consider 1 day credit towards mandatory report. 
DE to be released 7:00am Sat. morning Aug. 19th.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  Karleigh Miller  for Michael R. Cohen   DF:  Phillip Jon Mueller appeared. Cases called at 3:43 pm. Includes 15C376 and 15TR3862. Court reviews case. DEF waives right to jury trial. Court questions DEF as to waiver of jury trial. DEF understands rights. Off record 3:48 pm. On Record 4:08 pm. DEF confirms decision to waive jury trial. Court finds DEF freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to jury trial. Court removes Jury Trial from Court Calendar. Adjourned 4:11 pm

Final pre-trial on June 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on August 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Michael R. Cohen   DF:  Phillip Jon Mueller did not appear. Includes 15CF376, 15TR3862. Case called at 9:02 am. Atty. Cohen updates Court regarding non-appearance today. ADA Ellenwood does not request warrant. Atty. Cohen requests DEF get a new date to waive jury trial and set date for plea hearing. DEF works in Eau Claire and has an open case in Eau Claire County. Atty. Cohen is working on a resolution that would allow DEF to serve jail time in Eau Claire County. ADA Ellenwood responds and believes matter will be resolved.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle.  ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Phillip Jon Mueller appeared from jail. Defendant has copy of complaint.
